contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox river | name = Eagle River<ref name=GNIS>{{cite gnis|id= 174007|name=Eagle River|accessdate=2011-01-28}}</ref> | image_name = Eagle River Bridge.jpg | image_alt = | caption = Eagle River at [[Eagle, Colorado]] | image_map = | map_alt = | map_caption = | origin = Confluence of [[East Fork Eagle River|East Fork]] and [[South Fork Eagle River|South Fork]]<br>{{Coord|39|25|18|N|107|03|26|W|display=inline}} | mouth = Confluence with [[Colorado River]]<br>{{Coord|39|38|47|N|107|03|26|W|display=inline,title}} | basin_countries = | progression = [[Colorado River|Colorado]] | length_mi = | length = {{convert|60.5|mi|km|abbr=on}}<ref name=NHD/> | elevation_ft = | elevation = | mouth_elevation_ft = 6122 | mouth_elevation = | discharge_cuft/s = | discharge = {{convert|577|cuft/s|m3/s|abbr=on}}<ref name="NWIS">{{cite web|url=http://wdr.water.usgs.gov/wy2011/pdfs/09070000.2011.pdf|title=USGS Gage #09070000 on the Eagle River below Gypsum, CO|publisher=U.S. Geological Survey|work=National Water Information System|date=1946â€“2011|accessdate=2012-09-26}}</ref> | watershed_sqmi = | watershed = {{convert|945|mi2|km2|abbr=on}}<ref name="NWIS"/> | river_system = | left_tribs = | right_tribs = }} The '''Eagle River''' is a tributary of the [[Colorado River (U.S.)|Colorado River]], approximately {{convert|60.5|mi}} long,<ref name=NHD>U.S. Geological Survey. National Hydrography Dataset high-resolution flowline data. [http://viewer.nationalmap.gov/viewer/ The National Map], accessed March 18, 2011</ref> in west central [[Colorado]] in the [[United States]]. It rises in southeastern [[Eagle County, Colorado|Eagle County]], at the [[continental divide]], and flows northwest past [[Gilman, Colorado|Gilman]], [[Minturn, Colorado|Minturn]], [[Avon, Colorado|Avon]]. Near [[Wolcott, Colorado|Wolcott]], it turns west, flowing past [[Eagle, Colorado|Eagle]] and [[Gypsum, Colorado|Gypsum]], and joins the Colorado at [[Dotsero, Colorado|Dotsero]], in western Eagle County. The Eagle is navigable by typical small river craft upstream to Vail in most years. Its flow ranges from {{convert|200|cuft/s|m3/s|abbr=on}} in late summer of dry years to {{convert|7000|cuft/s|m3/s|abbr=on}} during spring runoff. [[Acid mine drainage]] from the abandoned [[Eagle Mine (Colorado)|Eagle Mine]] has entered the river.<ref name = epa2012>{{cite web|url=http://www.epa.gov/region8/superfund/co/eagle/index.html|title=Eagle Mine | Region 8 | US EPA|work=[[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] | date = April 2012 | accessdate=13 June 2012}}</ref> ==See also== * [[List of rivers of Colorado]] * [[List of tributaries of the Colorado River]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Geography of Eagle County, Colorado]] [[Category:Rivers of Colorado]] [[Category:Tributaries of the Colorado River in Colorado]]
